summaryText: Wow, what an incredible Mother's Day sermon focusing on radical sacrifice! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful and deeply personal message by interviewing his own mother, revealing a remarkable story of redemption, faith, and God's transformative power. Through his mother's testimony, PT demonstrates how God can take a life marked by brokenness, abuse, and pain and turn it into a beautiful testament of grace. The sermon powerfully illustrates that our past does not determine our future - God does! From teenage pregnancy to multiple marriages, sexual abuse to forgiveness, Tony Hearn's story shows that radical sacrifice isn't about grand gestures, but about consistently choosing God's path, even when it's difficult. Pastor Travis emphasizes that true sacrifice means laying down our own desires and picking up God's plan, just as his mother did throughout her life. Her willingness to love unconditionally, forgive the unforgivable, and remain committed to her faith is a powerful example of what radical Christianity looks like in real life.
mainPoints: God can redeem any broken situation
Radical sacrifice means choosing God's path over personal comfort
Our pain can become a powerful testimony when surrendered to God

versesMentioned.text: Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.
Blows and wounds cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the inmost being.

As for me, this is my covenant with them, says the Lord. My Spirit who is on you and my words that I have put in your mouth will not depart from your mouth, or from the mouths of your children, or from the mouths of their children's children, from this time on and forever, says the Lord.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's healing power in our brokenness
Monday.action: Write down one area of past hurt or pain. Spend time in prayer, asking God to bring healing and transformation to that specific area of your life.
Monday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my pain to you. Heal my broken places and help me see how you can turn my wounds into a powerful testimony of your grace. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Tuesday.focus: Embracing our new identity in Christ
Tuesday.action: List three ways your old self was different from who you are now in Christ. Celebrate the transformations God has already made in your life.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, thank you for making me new. Help me fully embrace the identity you've given me and live fully in your purpose. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:31-32: 'Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.'
Wednesday.action: Identify one relationship where you need to extend forgiveness. Write a letter (you don't have to send it) expressing your willingness to forgive.
Wednesday.prayer: God, give me the strength to forgive as you have forgiven me. Help me release any bitterness and choose love. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 12:1: 'Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.'
Thursday.action: Identify one area of your life where you're holding back from fully surrendering to God. Pray about dedicating that area completely to His purpose.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, show me where I'm reserving parts of my life for myself. Help me offer every aspect of my life as a living sacrifice to you. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.'
Friday.action: Reflect on a current challenge in your life. Journal about how God might be using this situation to strengthen your faith.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me trust you in the midst of my current struggles. Give me faith to see your hand at work, even when I can't see the whole picture. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: ''For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer, asking God to reveal His broader purpose for your life. Write down any insights or impressions you receive.
Saturday.prayer: God, I trust in your perfect plan. Help me to surrender my own desires and align my heart with your purpose. Use me for your glory. Amen.
